page.title: 08The Village Fete in Lavant 1
page.content: On Saturday the 29th.June,the Lavant Fete took place on the Village Green and in the Village Hall.There were a number of stalls,and the brownies were running a jam tart stall,there was also a book stall in the marquee,and the school ran a tombola stall.There was a pocket money stall,where everything was under 50p.I bought three packets of stamps.The stamps were 10p,20p,and 15p.Christine Buckland and Karen Hancock kept on saying _"Could we interest you in a jam tart for 5p each?".Every time they came to me I always said _ "No thank you!".The Chichester Recorder Band played in the arena.Not many people stopped to listen.But we didn't mind because they were all buying the different things there.
